markdownRemark.html:
confusion around undefined

It's quite common to encounter the term "undefined" in programming and website development. When something is declared as undefined, it means that the object, variable, function, or other item being declared has no form or value. But what does this really mean in a practical sense?

What does it mean to be "undefined"?

The majority of the time, when something is declared as undefined, it simply means that it has not yet been given a value. This can occur when a variable has been declared, but not yet assigned a value. An example of this is below:

let number;

The variable "number" has been declared, but it has not been assigned a value. Therefore, it is undefined.

In other cases, when an object, variable, or function is declared as undefined, it may mean that the item has been defined in the code but the value associated with it has not been found. Consider the following code:

let a = b;

In this example, the variable a has been assigned the value of the variable b. However, the variable b does not exist in the code, therefore, the value of a will be undefined.

Best practices for handling undefined

If you are working with JavaScript or any other programming language, there are a few steps you can take to ensure that you are properly handling undefined variables and objects:

  • Check for typos. If a function is declared as undefined, check for spelling errors in the function name.

  • Always set defaults. If you are working with variables and objects, it's a good idea to set default values, so that they are not left undefined.

  • Utilize error checking. If you are writing functions, it's important to account for possible errors that could arise, such as calling a function with an undefined argument.

  • Avoid declaring variables as undefined. Whenever possible, it's best to avoid declaring a variable with undefined as its value. Instead, explicitly set the value of the variable to something else.

By following these best practices, you can ensure that any errors related to undefined variables or objects are properly handled.

Conclusion

The concept of undefined is common in the world of programming and website development. Working with undefined variables or objects can be complex, but by following best practices such as setting defaults and utilizing error checking, you can ensure that any undefined values are handled properly.
